results.title: Popeye
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Robert Evans and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The comic strip and animated sailor hero with a thing for spinach comes to life in this meticulous live action kids film. Director Robert Altman traces the origins of Popeye, his battle against arch-rival Bluto and his budding romance with Olive Oyl. Cast includes Robin Williams, Shelley Duvall, Ray Walston, Paul L. Smith, Paul Dooley.

results.title: Pop movie. Part 2
results.brief_description: Fremont High School in Elizabeth Park South Australia is a school that is becoming famous for its musical productions. A group of students who are involved in the production of a Rock Musical from casting to preparation of a backdrop which depicts the area in which they live show the fun and sharing that occurs during rehearsals for the show “Type Cast”. Students commence on the breaking down of class level barriers that normally exist in schools, on the ease of communicating with teachers as they learn about devising and producing a pop musical. Positive attitudes are fostered, about self and ability and all regard the experience as “great”!

results.title: Pop movie. Part 1
results.brief_description: A six part series offering an in-depth view of the rock music industry. To those who are fans or aspire to a career in music it is compulsory viewing; and for a more general audience it is an insight into the chaotic world of rock `n’ roll.

results.title: Pop Colorture  Zach Smothers

constellations_other.name: Communicating colour
constellations_other.description: An exploration of colour on-screen inspired by Technicolor supervisor, Natalie Kalmus.

results.description: Colorist Zach Smothers brings 1950s and 60s sitcoms back to life, aiming to “bring colours and film tones into harmony, and create realistic color palettes that match the familiar look of film”.
description_for_label: Colorist Zach Smothers brings 1950s and 60s sitcoms back to life, aiming to “bring colours and film tones into harmony, and create realistic color palettes that match the familiar look of film”.

results.title: Pop and Op Art
results.brief_description: A two part look at the development of Pop Art in both the United States and in Europe. The first program traces the work of major Pop artists such as Roy Lichtenstein, Andy Warhol, George Segal and Robert Rauschenberg with a discussion of the subjects, styles and themes common to Pop Art and its manifestations in painting, photography, three dimensional installations and staged “happenings”. The boundary between commercial art and Pop Art is also discussed with particular reference to the intentions behind the work where familiar objects are placed out of context, though not necessarily for the purposes of social comment. The second part details European Pop Art and the stronger critique engaged in both in reference to American art and the political contexts within which they were produced. Artists such as Christo and Marciel Raysse are discussed in detail, with attention to their aims of creating a new synthetic reality to evoke impermanence and disorder and neutralise and deglamourise commercial, mechanical and iconic imagery. This second program also looks at Optical art, detailing its focus on geometrical patterns, flat colours and optical illusions, both in terms of its history and in terms of the work of modern artists such as Joseph Albers and Bridgette Riley.

results.title: Pop & op art
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History through art”.
Surveys the two art movements known as pop and op art, showing examples from the work of pop and op artists, quoting their expressed intentions and attitudes, and comparing pop and op art with earlier art movements.

results.title: Pop-Up Television Radio Model TR-475U
results.material_description: plastic body with silver metal handle, trim and antenna.
results.brief_description:
National Transistor TV. Model TR-475U. Pop-up screen and pull out handle for portablity.
No power cords, batteries only.

Brand: National

Serial no. F 3 (??) 1113
TQF8125

National Transistor TV
Model TR-475U DC12V 11W
Matsushita Electric Industrial Co. Ltd
Made in Japan
TBM 81685

Caution: To prevernt electric shock, do not remove cover. No user-serviceable parts inside, and pilot lamp soldered in place. Refer servicing to qualified service personnel.

Note: Before opening the pop-up portion of this TV. Please release two red screws fixed on the bottom side of the set. These screws are fixed for delivery safety only. The battery enclosed in this TV receiver is disconnected to assure longer life.

Before use, it must be properly connected. Please see instruction manual. For longer battery life: charge more than 10 hours before initial use. After each use once a month.

There are no power cords accompanying the TV.
results.description:
The National Transistor TV Radio Model TR-475U is a battery-operated, portable model features an inbuilt radio and a ‘pop-up’ television screen.
National was a brand used by Panasonic Corporation sell home appliances, personal appliances, and industrial appliances. The National brand operated in Australia until 1988 when it transferred to The Panasonic Corporation.

results.title: Poor man's orange (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Whaley, Anthony Buckley, Quantum Films and Anthony Buckley Productions
results.brief_description: Television dramatisation of the second of Ruth Park’s novels covering the trials and tribulations of the poor Irish-Australian Darcy family of number 12 1/2 Plymouth Street in Surrey Hills - a Sydney slum. In this series it is the 1950’s and all the Darcy children have grown up yet they still have to face the problems of their working class background.
